com.aj.android.commons.database

Class DBUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aj.android.commons.database.DBUtils

  • public class DBUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of generic methods for common purpose task in SQLiteDatabase.
    Author:
    Akhil Jain

    • Method Detail

      • getAllTableNames

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllTableNames(SQLiteDatabase readableDatabase)
        Get all table names present in given database in List format, except android_metadata and sqlite_sequence.
        SQLiteDatabase is closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        readableDatabase - -SQLiteDatabase pass readable instance of database.
        Returns:
        ArrayList<String> -of all the table names, present in database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.

      • getSqliteBoolean

        public static int getSqliteBoolean(boolean value)
        SQLite does not have a separate Boolean storage class.
        Instead, Boolean values are stored as integers 0 (false) and 1 (true).
        If value is true it returns 1, else 0;
        Parameters:
        value - boolean value-either true or false
        Returns:
        either numeric 0 or 1

      • getBoolean

        public static boolean getBoolean(int sqliteValue)
        SQLite does not have a separate Boolean storage class.
        Instead, Boolean values are stored as integers 0 (false) and 1 (true).
        If value is 1 it returns true, else false;
        Parameters:
        sqliteValue - int value-either 1 or 0
        Returns:
        either true or false

      • getCount

        public static int getCount(java.lang.String tableName,
                           SQLiteDatabase readableDatabase)
        Gets the number of rows present in the given table for the given database.
        SQLiteDatabase is closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        tableName - -String table name for which row count is required.
        readableDatabase - -SQLiteDatabase pass readable instance of database.
        Returns:
        int -number of rows present in database, else -1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.

      • getIndexOfColumns

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getIndexOfColumns(Cursor cursor)
        Retrieve the index for the given cursor, based on column name and index position for the column in cursor.
        Parameters:
        cursor - -Cursor for which index of columns is required.
        Returns:
        HashMap<String,Integer> - where Key is the String column name and Integer corresponding column index in the cursor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.

      • checkIfColumnExist

        public static boolean checkIfColumnExist(SQLiteDatabase readableDatabase,
                                         java.lang.String tableName,
                                         java.lang.String columnName)
        Check if the column table name exist in given table and database.
        SQLiteDatabase is closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        tableName - -String table name where needs to be searched.
        columnName - -String column name which needs to be searched.
        readableDatabase - -SQLiteDatabase pass readable instance of database.
        Returns:
        boolean -returns true if the table exist in the database, else false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.

      • checkIfTableExist

        public static boolean checkIfTableExist(java.lang.String tableName,
                                        SQLiteDatabase readableDatabase)
        Check if the given table name exist in given database or not.
        SQLiteDatabase is closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        tableName - -String table name which needs to be searched.
        readableDatabase - -SQLiteDatabase pass readable instance of database.
        Returns:
        boolean -returns true if the table exist in the database, else false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.

      • containsRecords

        public static boolean containsRecords(java.lang.String tableName,
                                      SQLiteDatabase readableDatabase)
        Check if given table contain any records. Returns true if the table has even one record, else false.
        SQLiteDatabase is closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        tableName - -String table name which needs to be looked for any record.
        readableDatabase - -SQLiteDatabase pass readable instance of database.
        Returns:
        boolean -returns true if table contain any records, else false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.

      • addColumn

        public static void addColumn(SQLiteDatabase writableDatabase,
                             java.lang.String tableName,
                             java.lang.String columnName,
                             DBUtils.SQLITE_DATA_TYPE dataType)
        Add new Column to database, the new column is added to last of database.
        Parameters:
        writableDatabase - -SQLiteDatabase pass writable instance of database.
        tableName - -String table name where needs to be searched.
        columnName - -String column name which needs to be searched.
        dataType - -DBUtils.SQLITE_DATA_TYPE datatype for sqlite.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.

      • insertRecords

        public static long insertRecords(java.lang.String tableName,
                                 ContentValues contentValues,
                                 SQLiteDatabase writableDatabase)
        Inserting the records into the given table in the given database.
        SQLiteDatabase is closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        tableName - -String table name where records needs to be saved.
        contentValues - -ContentValues bundle of values which needs to be saved.
        writableDatabase - -SQLiteDatabase pass writable instance of database.
        Returns:
        int -row count where record is inserted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.

      • dropTable

        public static void dropTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                             SQLiteDatabase writableDatabase)
        Drop / Remove the table from the given database.
        SQLiteDatabase is closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        tableName - -String table name which needs to be removed.
        writableDatabase - -SQLiteDatabase pass writable instance of database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.

      • dropAllTables

        public static void dropAllTables(SQLiteDatabase writableDatabase)
        Drop / Remove all tables from the given database.
        SQLiteDatabase is closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        writableDatabase - -SQLiteDatabase pass writable instance of database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.

      • deleteAllData

        public static void deleteAllData(java.lang.String tableName,
                                 SQLiteDatabase writableDatabase)
        Delete all the data in the given table from given database.
        SQLiteDatabase is closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        tableName - -String table name from which data needs to be deleted.
        writableDatabase - -SQLiteDatabase pass writable instance of database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.

      • closeDBConnection

        public static void closeDBConnection(SQLiteDatabase database,
                                     Cursor cursor)
        Close if SQLiteDatabase or Cursor is open. 
        E.g.,
 closeDBConnection(database,cursor);
 closeDBConnection(null,cursor);
 closeDBConnection(database,null);
        Parameters:
        database - -SQLiteDatabase which has to be closed.
        cursor - -Cursor which has to be closed.
